data.Title: DOJ May Break Up Google
data.Description: The US Department of Justice is considering breaking up Google, potentially separating Android, Chrome, and Google Ads.  Other scenarios include forcing Google to share data with competitors.

data.Title: Google Gemini Research to Introduce AI-Powered Citations
data.Description: Google Gemini Research will soon feature AI-generated citations and links to websites, potentially transforming how users research topics online.

data.Title: Google Hotel Listings Targeted by Hijackers
data.Description: Google Hotel listings are being targeted by hijackers who are adding fake WhatsApp numbers and marking hotels as permanently closed.

data.Title: Bing Search Outperformed Google in Speed in 2017
data.Description: Internal Google documents from 2017 reveal that Bing Search was faster than Google, particularly for mobile searches, according to information revealed during the DOJ antitrust trials.

data.Title: Publishers See Strong Q2 Earnings
data.Description: Publishers are reporting positive Q2 2024 earnings, driven by AI deals and an improved ad market.

data.Title: Political Ad Spending Favors Connected TV
data.Description: Political ad spending is increasing, with Connected TV (CTV) emerging as a major beneficiary.

data.Title: Criteo Explores Acquisition of Skai
data.Description: Criteo is in talks to acquire Skai (formerly Kenshoo) to enhance its retail media capabilities and measurement tools.

data.Title: Brands Prefer Instagram Over Facebook for Marketing
data.Description: Research indicates that brands find Instagram to be a more effective marketing platform compared to Facebook, despite Facebook's large user base and ad spending.

data.Title: Google Search Console Data Accuracy Questioned
data.Description: Questions arise about the accuracy of data in Google Search Console, with some suggesting it may only show a portion of actual data.

data.Title: Google AI Overviews Shift Focus from Reddit to YouTube
data.Description: A study reveals that Google's AI-powered search overviews are now prioritizing YouTube and LinkedIn over Reddit as sources of information.

data.Title: Ahrefs to Introduce "Patches" Feature for Site Audit Tool
data.Description: Ahrefs is developing a new "Patches" feature for their Site Audit tool, allowing users to directly address and fix website issues identified during audits.
